title: Because And Because Of Grammar Exercise

questions.question: We got into trouble ............................... you.
questions.description: Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or pronoun.

questions.question: We cancelled the trip ............................. bad weather.
questions.description: Because of is a preposition. It should be followed by a noun or pronoun.

questions.question: We hurried indoors ....................... it was raining.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause.

questions.question: She passed the test .................................. her teacher.
She passed the test .......................... she had a good teacher.
questions.description: Because should be followed by a clause.

questions.question: I couldn't arrive on time .............................. I had missed the train.
He can't walk .................................. arthritis.
questions.description: Because of is followed by a noun/pronoun.

questions.question: She didn't pass the test .......................... she hadn't studied well.
questions.description: We use a clause after because.

questions.question: Thousands of people lost their jobs ............................ the recession.
I couldn't understand him .......................... his strange accent.
The government banned that movie ........................ the public opinion was against it.
He met with an accident ......................... he was driving too fast.
